attributes.action: Recognize spaghetti colander as a religious headwear for driving license photos.
attributes.additional_details:
the current guidelines of the DVLA do not allow for headwear in driving license photos, except for religious or medical reasons.
the spaghetti colander is a legitimate religious headwear and should be recognized. all individuals should have the freedom to express their religious beliefs in a manner that is important to them. The recognition of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster and its religious symbols would be a significant step towards promoting diversity and tolerance in the UK
attributes.background: As a member of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster, I believe that wearing a spaghetti colander as my religious headwear is an essential expression of my faith. I want the UK to Amend policy to allow expression of faith & promote diversity.

rejection.details: Decisions regarding what is, or is not acceptable in driving licence photos, are an operational matter for the DVLA, and not that of the Government or Parliament.
